ITEM.TITLE: Issue 29
ITEM.DESC:
Woodworking has always seemed equal parts challenging and inviting to us. Where do you even start?
You start here: we’ve taken the complex art of woodworking and distilled it to the basics. The tools, the materials you need, and a first project that will get you well on your way to building your own unique creations.

ITEM.TITLE: Issue 28
ITEM.DESC: You don't have to understand electronics to be a maker, but adding a few billion electrons can add light, interactivity, motion, or (some limited) intelligence to the things you make. In this issue we'll help you get started with electronics and build better circuits.

ITEM.TITLE: Issue 27
ITEM.DESC: The Raspberry Pi is the world's favourite little computer. From facial recognition to underwater cameras to smart prosthetic arms, we explore the ways that makers have used the Raspberry Pi to build fantastic creations.

ITEM.DESC: What's the best 3D printer? We asked real users about their experiences with their own printers, and here are the results. Find your perfect 3D printer with out guide.
